Summary: The 3 West Club is located across the street from Rockefeller Center and has views of St. Patrick's Cathedral and Radio City Music Hall; it is part of the Republican National Women's Club. The hotel offers clean, basic rooms and a complimentary breakfast, but lacks luxury amenities like room service.

The 414 Hotel is a small, calm, and intimate haven near Restaurant Row and Times Square, with a charming leafy patio and mosaic tables; the rooms feature striking photographic cityscapes and sumptuous white down comforters. The hotel is located on a quiet street and some rooms overlook a courtyard, allowing guests to hear birdsong in the morning.

60 Thompson is a stylish hotel in SoHo with a chic lobby bar, rooftop bar, and well-designed rooms, offering a calm and quiet feel in a bustling neighborhood. Some found the hotel to have a Euro-hip vibe, with a cool scene and sexy international types.

6 Columbus is a modern, intimate hotel with sleek design, often described as trendy or hip, with dark hallways and elevators covered in faux fur. The hotel is located near Central Park, and has a sushi restaurant and bar with a vibrant atmosphere.

70 Park Avenue is described as a quiet, centrally located hotel in a residential area, with comfortable beds, soundproof rooms, and blackout shades. Some reviewers note the hotel feels like a cocoon and an escape from the chaos of the city.

The Ace Hotel has a unique, hipster vibe with a dark, garage-chic style, and quirky decor including reclaimed furniture, guitars, record players, and SMEG fridges. The lobby is designed with comfy sofas, a big library table, and a photo booth.

The Affinia 50 has spacious rooms, with a club room on the second floor, which offers a relaxed environment with a TV and fireplace. The hotel has rooms with full kitchens and balconies with views of the city, and is located in a quiet area near main attractions.

The Affinia Dumont features large, clean rooms, many with views of the Chrysler building and the East River, and is located in the relatively quiet Murray Hill neighborhood. It offers a gym, fitness kits, and sound-reducing rooms.

Affinia Gardens is described as a tranquil oasis with spacious, clean rooms and comfortable beds, located on a quiet street on the Upper East Side. The hotel has a "tranquility" theme, accented with a tea bar and relaxation kits.
While the Affinia Manhattan is centrally located and offers spacious rooms, some guests found it noisy due to its proximity to a fire station and busy streets, making it less ideal as an escape.

The Affinia Shelburne offers quiet, quiet, and comfortable rooms with breathtaking views of the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings. Located in the Murray Hill neighborhood, it is removed from the Times Square crowds, but within walking distance of Grand Central station, and has blackout curtains for comfortable sleeping.

AKA United Nations offers spacious, modern apartments with full kitchens and comfortable living spaces, providing a more private and self-contained environment compared to a standard hotel room. The hotel's location in a residential side street, away from the main road, may offer a quieter experience, although some rooms are subject to city noise or construction.

The Algonquin Hotel is a historic boutique hotel with a charming, old-world atmosphere, featuring a cozy lobby, retro decor, New Yorker cartoon wallpaper, and comfortable beds, offering a quiet escape from the bustling city. The hotel has a literary history and a resident cat, Matilda.

The Americana Inn is a budget hotel in midtown Manhattan, with small, clean rooms and shared bathrooms; some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic. It is located near Times Square, the Empire State Building, and other attractions, and has a secure entrance.

The Amsterdam Court Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and subway lines, but many rooms are small, dimly lit, and some have views of brick walls or internal lightwells. Some guests have reported issues with noise, temperature control, cleanliness, and outdated facilities, while others found the hotel clean and adequate for sleeping.

Astor on the Park is located on Central Park West, opposite Central Park, with subway access a few blocks away, and is described as a small, basic, European-style hotel that can be quiet, with some rooms having a view of Central Park and the city skyline. It is located a bit out of the way from downtown.

The Hotel Bedford offers spacious rooms and suites with kitchenettes, creating a home-away-from-home atmosphere, with some rooms offering views of the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building. The hotel's location near Grand Central Station provides easy access to the city, while the hotel itself is situated on a quieter street.

The Beekman Tower is located in a quiet, residential neighborhood removed from the hustle and bustle of the city, with spacious suites that include kitchens, offering a feeling of having your own New York apartment. The hotel is an art deco building with a bar/restaurant on the top floor that has great views of the city and the East River.

The Belleclaire Hotel is located on the Upper West Side, near Central Park and subway lines, with clean but small rooms that are often described as "urban apartments," and some rooms have city views. Several reviewers noted noise from the street or building, but also mentioned sound-proofing elements such as double-paned windows or quieter rooms at the back of the hotel.

The Bentley Hotel offers a quiet, boutique-like feeling due to its location on the lower end of the upper east side in a residential neighborhood, with some rooms featuring East River views; some reviewers found the area conveniently located near the Animal Medical Center. The rooftop bar and restaurant offers great city skyline views.
The hotel is located in the heart of Chinatown and close to Little Italy, with subway access nearby. The hotel has clean, modern rooms and is a good value for the location.

The Best Western Convention Center is located in an industrial area with a 24-hour auto shop across the street, stables up the street, and construction nearby, but is surprisingly quiet inside. Some reviewers describe the area as "weird" and "desolate," but note that it is close to Times Square and the Javits Center.

Best Western Hospitality House is an apartment-style hotel with spacious rooms, full kitchens, and a central Manhattan location within walking distance of major attractions. Some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic.

The Best Western Seaport Inn is located in the South Street Seaport area near the Brooklyn Bridge. The hotel is located in a quieter part of Manhattan on cobblestone streets near shops and restaurants, and some rooms have views of the Brooklyn Bridge.

The Blue Moon Hotel, a renovated historic tenement building in the Lower East Side, offers a unique, museum-like atmosphere with vintage decor, artifacts, and spacious rooms named after 1930s-40s celebrities, providing a cozy and romantic ambiance. It is located away from the tourist areas.

The slightly hidden Broadway Plaza Hotel features friendly staff, comfortable rooms, and clean bathrooms, offering a transformation once inside. Rooms on the tenth floor provide incredible views of the Empire State Building, which changes the color of its lights almost every night.

The Buckingham Hotel is steeped in musical history, with decor that is artsey and unique with little signage, jazz music in the elevator, and a cool sculpture in the lobby, offering a different experience from chain hotels. It is located across from Carnegie Hall, where performers often stay, and some rooms have been renovated with fancy bathroom fixtures, offering a New York apartment feel.

The Candlewood Suites Times Square offers studio suites with mini-kitchens, full-sized refrigerators, and quiet rooms, located a short walk from Times Square. Some rooms on higher floors offer views of the Empire State Building and the Hudson River.

The Carlton Arms is an old, budget-friendly hotel where each room and hallway is uniquely decorated by artists, creating a surreal and funky atmosphere. Guests can choose their room based on the artwork, but should expect a no-frills experience with shared bathrooms in some rooms, and potential noise.
The Carvi Hotel is a small, new, and clean hotel with comfortable beds, marble bathrooms, and flat-screen TVs. Some rooms have views facing other buildings with building air conditioning noise.

Casablanca Hotel is a small boutique hotel located steps from Times Square, yet is a quiet and peaceful escape from the city, with many guests describing it as an oasis. The hotel offers a library-style lounge with complimentary snacks and beverages, and also a free wine and cheese reception in the evenings.

Chambers Hotel is a stylish, modern, and chic boutique hotel with an industrial feel, unique art pieces, and rooms with sketch pads and colored pencils. Some reviewers describe it as a hip, trendy hotel with a cool bar and restaurant, while others mention the lobby's design resembling a set from "Sex in the City."

Chelsea Lodge is described as a charming, cozy brownstone with unique, clean rooms, a New England-style decor, and a quiet atmosphere, situated in a safe, residential neighborhood away from the city's hustle and bustle. Some reviewers mention waking up to birdsong, giving it an "oasis" feel despite its central Manhattan location.
Chelsea Pines Inn is a movie-themed hotel decorated with posters of silver screen actors, offering uniquely decorated rooms. Many describe it as having a charming or quirky atmosphere.

The Chelsea Savoy offers a basic, clean, and quiet experience with small rooms, making it a practical choice for travelers focused on exploring the city rather than luxurious accommodations. Rooms on the higher floors away from the street may offer a quieter stay.

The City Club Hotel features a trendy and modern design with dark colors and dim lighting, with some rooms including hidden TVs, mirrored walls, and spacious marble bathrooms to create a unique atmosphere. The hotel's small size and discreet entrance offer a quiet, intimate, and private experience, acting as a respite from the pace of Manhattan.

The Solita Soho Hotel is a small, modern hotel in lower Manhattan, located at the edge of Soho and close to Little Italy and Chinatown, with clean, well-appointed rooms and flat-screen TVs; some rooms have views of the Empire State Building. A nightclub is adjoined to the hotel, but higher floors are less affected by the noise.

Club Quarters Downtown is located in the Financial District, which is described as a ghost town on the weekends, offering peace and quiet away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The hotel has clean, modern rooms and is close to subway lines for easy access to other parts of Manhattan.

Club Quarters Midtown is located close to Times Square and Grand Central Station, with a lounge featuring comfortable seating areas and free computers. Some rooms are small with views of air conditioning units, and the hotel has small elevators and a gym.

The Club Quarters Rockefeller Center is located in midtown Manhattan, close to many attractions. Some reviewers note quiet rooms with views of St. Patrick's Cathedral, the Rockefeller Skating Rink, and Radio City Music Hall.

Located on a quiet side street in the Chelsea/Flatiron area, some guests found the hotel quiet enough to be an escape from the noisy city. The hotel is near antique stores and a flea market is open on weekends.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan has stained glass windows in the reception/bar area and is in an older building with a quaint old-fashioned spiraling staircase & outside mason brick exterior. Some reviewers noted that rooms at the rear of the hotel overlooking the aircon units can be noisy.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge is located in the lively, bustling Chinatown area, but offers clean and quiet rooms on the upper floors, providing a hideaway from the neighborhood's activity. The hotel's location provides easy access to various neighborhoods and subway lines while still being somewhat removed from the busier midtown area.

The Comfort Inn Midtown is conveniently located near Times Square, yet rooms are generally quiet, especially those facing away from the street. Rooms offer comfortable beds and are newly renovated, offering a haven from the busy city.
Some rooms are located below ground level and some open straight off the lobby. The hotel is located close to Times Square and the Theater District.
The Comfort Inn is located on a quiet street and upper floors have city views. The hotel is situated in a warehouse district and feels isolated.

The hotel is described as small and narrow, with modern decor, and is located a few blocks from Times Square, close to transportation and attractions. Some rooms on higher floors offer views of the New York Times building.

The Cooper Square Hotel is a modern, design-focused hotel with floor-to-ceiling windows offering city views, a library-themed lobby, and a bar/nightclub. It features unique touches like dimmed lighting, curated book selections, and unconventional check-in in a living room-like space.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is located in Tribeca, near subway lines, and offers clean rooms and a location away from the touristy midtown area. Some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic or air conditioning units.

This hotel is described as an oasis of calm and quiet comfort, despite being located only 150 feet from Broadway and a few blocks from Times Square. The hotel is tall and narrow, sandwiched between two office buildings in the middle of the block, creating a quiet atmosphere.

The Courtyard Upper East Side is located in a quiet, residential neighborhood and is close to the East River and Carl Schurz Park, providing a sense of escape. The hotel has a pool, fitness center, and steam room for relaxation.

The hotel is described as offering peace and tranquility, providing an escape from the cold and busy city. Rooms on higher floors (24th-30th) towards the back of the building are reported to be very quiet.

The hotel is situated in a more subdued part of Manhattan, away from the crowds, and is described as quiet, clean, and spacious. The hotel features upper-level rooms with great views of the city, and soundproof rooms.

The Crosby Street Hotel is praised for its unique and artistic decor, spacious rooms, and attention to detail, offering a museum-like atmosphere with a personal touch. The hotel's design includes tall warehouse-style windows, individually designed rooms, and oak-tree floors.

The Crowne Plaza Times Square offers rooms on higher floors with great views, including some overlooking Times Square or the Hudson River. The hotel is known for being very quiet despite its central location in the bustling Times Square area.

The Da Vinci is described as a small, European-style hotel with a cozy atmosphere, marble and cherry wood lobby, and a gas fireplace. Some rooms have views of brick walls, and the hotel has a restaurant and bar.

The Doubletree Guest Suites is located in the heart of Times Square, but its high-floor rooms are quiet and provide amazing views, with blackout curtains to block out the lights. The hotel rooms are spacious suites with a separate living room, a comfortable bed, and helpful staff, offering a serene contrast to the hustle and bustle outside.

The Doubletree Hotel Chelsea offers modern, clean rooms with comfortable beds and often a view of the Empire State Building. Its location is close to Penn Station and other attractions, while the hotel itself provides a quiet atmosphere.

The hotel is described as having a modern, retro, and clean atmosphere with flat screen TVs, new furnishings, and quality linens. It is within walking distance of shopping and several attractions and is near a subway, but offers a bar for those that want to stay in.

The Dream Hotel is a trendy, modern hotel with blue neon lighting and a fish tank in the lobby, offering an eclectic atmosphere and a rooftop bar with city views. Some rooms have views of air shafts or brick walls and can be noisy due to street noise or the rooftop bar.

The Duane Street Hotel is described as a small, modern, and clean boutique hotel in the Tribeca area, with comfortable beds and soundproofed rooms, offering an escape from the midtown crowds. Some reviewers noted street noise and subway rumbles, while others found it quiet and relaxing, with a cozy vibe.

The Dylan Hotel is described as a quiet and comfortable sanctuary in the heart of midtown Manhattan, with spacious rooms and high ceilings that provide a peaceful retreat from the city. Its location near Grand Central Terminal offers convenient access to transportation while maintaining a calm atmosphere.

The Eastgate Tower has spacious, apartment-like suites with full kitchens, offering a quiet and comfortable stay away from the bustling city, and is conveniently located near Grand Central Station. While the decor is dated, the hotel is clean, and the staff are friendly and helpful.

This hotel is located near Times Square, but the rooms are small and there can be street noise. Some reviewers mention that the hotel provides a clean and functional space for sleeping, with amenities like a continental breakfast and free Wi-Fi.

The Embassy Suites offers clean, spacious suites with views of the Hudson River, free breakfast, and evening drinks, providing a quiet and peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle, though it is located away from the main tourist attractions. The hotel is located near the Hudson River, close to the WTC site, and features comfortable rooms with TVs, and access to the NY Sports Club.

The Empire Hotel is a trendy, recently renovated hotel with a rooftop bar and pool (seasonal) offering city views. Rooms are small, but well-appointed and comfortable, with a mostly quiet atmosphere despite its central location near Lincoln Center and Central Park.

The Envoy Club offers spacious apartment-style rooms with fully equipped kitchens, providing a home-away-from-home atmosphere, and features a rooftop deck with views of the Manhattan skyline. Its location in Murray Hill offers a quieter environment compared to busier areas of Manhattan.

The hotel has a stylish, boutique feel with modern and big rooms, and is located in a quiet area of the Financial District near the South Street Seaport. Some rooms have plasma TVs, large beds, leather couches, and free internet access.

The Excelsior Hotel, located on the Upper West Side near Central Park, offers a residential, quieter atmosphere away from busier areas like Times Square. The hotel has a traditional, European-style decor with elegant, wood-paneled lobbies.

The Fairfield Inn is a new hotel with clean, comfortable rooms, though small, and is conveniently located near Times Square and the subway. The hotel is situated on a gritty street near the Port Authority and adult shops, but is within walking distance of various attractions and restaurants.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is described as an Irish oasis with a warm, homely feel, offering a quiet respite from the city, reminiscent of the charm and goodwill experienced in Ireland, complete with a library. Some rooms have private outdoor spaces and the hotel has a pub with a courtyard that feels like a retreat.

The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is described as having a quiet and intimate atmosphere, with comfortable rooms and a welcoming staff that creates a "home away from home" feel. Some reviewers mentioned the hotel's luxurious touches, such as comfortable beds, high-end linens, and turndown service, while others appreciated the cozy Irish pub-style bar.

The Flatotel offers spacious rooms and suites, some with balconies and kitchenettes, located in midtown Manhattan near Times Square and Central Park. Some reviewers mention the hotel has a modern, minimalist decor that may not appeal to all.
The hotel rooms are quiet, with good noise reduction from the outside. The rooms are described as dark due to dark colored walls and lacking natural light.

The Four Points Soho has modern, clean rooms, with some offering views of the Empire State Building or downtown Manhattan. It is located in a mixed commercial-residential area, a few blocks from SoHo's shops and restaurants, with a subway station nearby.

Rooms have comfortable beds, iHome docks, and flatscreen TVs, but some have views of the Port Authority Bus Terminal or a pigeon-poop stained building. The hotel is near adult DVD stores and the NY Division of Parole, and some guests found the area sketchy, but is close to Times Square and subway lines.

The Four Seasons New York has a grand lobby with marble and high ceilings, creating a calm and quiet atmosphere, and spacious rooms with Central Park and city views. The hotel has a spa and fitness center located several floors underground.

Gild Hall has a "modern hunting lodge chic" aesthetic with quirky touches like a rhino footrest, antler chandeliers, leather sofas, and vintage photos. The hotel is in the Financial District which is quiet and away from the crowds, especially on weekends.

Gramercy Park Hotel is a stylish, artsy hotel with a dark, moody aesthetic, unique decor, and themed rooms that some reviewers compared to a movie set, an opium den, or an eccentric aunt's guest quarters. The hotel offers access to the private Gramercy Park and features a rooftop lounge/garden and the Rose Bar, creating a unique and exclusive atmosphere.

The Grand Hyatt is connected to Grand Central Terminal and has an impressive and vast lobby with water features. The hotel may be an attractive option for tourists who want to be in the city and need an escape.

The Greenwich Hotel offers a relaxing and stylish escape with a gorgeous spa, sensory lobby, drawing room, and a courtyard, providing a peaceful ambiance. Its unique decor, reminiscent of an Italian villa or Swiss chalet, creates a homey feel, and the rooms are quiet and comfortable, blocking out street noise.

The Hampton Inn Empire State Building is a new, modern hotel with clean rooms, comfortable beds, and flat-screen TVs; it is located near major attractions and offers free breakfast, Wi-Fi, and a business center. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building and Macy's.

The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden offers clean, modern rooms with comfortable beds and flat-screen TVs, as well as amenities like free internet and breakfast, providing a comfortable and convenient base for exploring the city. The hotel's staff is friendly and helpful, but some reviewers noted the rooms can be small and the immediate neighborhood may feel a bit shady.
The Hampton Inn Chelsea has soundproofed rooms and is located on a relatively quiet street, making it an oasis in the middle of Manhattan. Some rooms on higher floors offer skyline views.

The Hampton Inn SoHo offers a modern, trendy atmosphere with design elements like exposed beams, steel, glass, and a greenhouse featuring a stream and Buddha head. Upper floors offer views of the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings, providing a scenic escape.

The Hampton Inn Times Square South is a tall, narrow, high-rise hotel with only six rooms per floor, offering quiet rooms with double windows for soundproofing. Some rooms have nice views, and the hotel is conveniently located near Times Square and Broadway.
The Hampton Inn Seaport is located in a historic area with cobblestone streets and old warehouses, near the Brooklyn Bridge. Some rooms have terraces with views of the seaport and Brooklyn Bridge.

The Helmsley Middletowne is an older hotel with large rooms, some renovated, and suites that include kitchenettes, though lacking a coffee maker or range. Some rooms have views of the Chrysler Building, and the location provides walking distance access to Grand Central, Times Square, and the Empire State Building.

The Hilton Club offers a small hotel experience within a large hotel, with suites located on the 37th and 38th floors, featuring a private check-in desk and dedicated elevators. Rooms are newly decorated, and the hotel is in a central Manhattan location, steps away from Rockefeller Center and minutes from Times Square.

The Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea is described as a small, intimate, new, and modern "boutique-style" hotel that is set back from the sidewalk which contributes to its tranquil atmosphere. Its upper floors offer great views, particularly on the north side towards the Empire State Building, and it's located in the Flower District where guests can walk through fragrant spring bulbs, away from the hustle and bustle of NYC.
The Hilton Garden Inn is a new, clean hotel with soundproof rooms, and blackout shades. It's conveniently located near a subway, Macy's, and the Empire State Building.

The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square is near Times Square and Broadway, and features blackout curtains and soundproof rooms with an openable window to let in fresh air. However, some reviewers note noise from the street or subway depending on the room's floor and location.

The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood, away from the touristy areas of Midtown and Times Square, and offers a convenient location to the subway. The hotel is near Soho shopping and restaurants, and within walking distance of the WTC site, Brooklyn Bridge, and Greenwich Village.

The Hilton New York is a large, busy hotel with a bustling lobby, and while offering modern, comfortable rooms, they can be noisy. It can also be a hectic, impersonal experience due to its size and convention-focused atmosphere.

Located just off Times Square on 42nd street, the Hilton offers clean and quiet rooms, starting from the 21st floor, with large windows offering great views of the city. Guests describe it as an oasis of tranquility above the bustle of Times Square.
The Holiday Inn Express Fifth Avenue has quiet rooms and blackout blinds to keep out the light. It is located a few blocks from Time Square, but without the hustling bustlig of tourists.
Rooms are quiet, located on higher floors, and offer partial views of the Hudson River. The hotel is new, clean, and modern.
The hotel is described as clean, modern, and new as of late 2006, with comfortable beds, jaccuzi tubs, and clean bathrooms. It has good location, free internet access, and a free juice machine.
The Holiday Inn is located in Chinatown, near Little Italy and a short subway ride from many area attractions. The area is described as a lively, safe area from early morning to late night.

The Holiday Inn Midtown offers a rooftop pool with city views on the 14th floor, though it's only open during the summer. Some reviewers note the hotel is older and in need of renovation, which may detract from a sense of escape.

The hotel has views of the Empire State Building and lower Manhattan, and is located in a quiet street between Chelsea and the Flatiron District, away from the crowds of Times Square. Rooms are small, but clean, with comfortable beds and HD TVs, and there is a bar that provides a larger space to socialize away from busy crowds in the lobby.

Hotel 17 has a quirky, old-fashioned charm with dark wood trim, eclectic decor, and some rooms have odd wall paper; the hotel feels like a movie set, and is located in a quiet neighborhood. The hotel is a simpler accommodation, with shared bathrooms, small rooms, and no extra frills.

Hotel 31 is a budget-friendly hotel with a retro feel, high ceilings, and wood mouldings, offering a quaint NYC experience. The hotel has a film noir style and old-style charm, with old-fashioned elevators, that some found added to the personality of the hotel.

Hotel 373 is a small, modern, and clean hotel located on 5th Avenue, close to the Empire State Building, with Starbucks connected to the lobby, offering comfortable beds and a convenient location for exploring the city. The rooms are small, with limited storage space, and street noise can be an issue for some guests.

Hotel 41 is a small, clean, and modern boutique hotel located just off Times Square, offering quiet rooms with comfortable beds, Aveda bath products, DVD players, and free DVD rentals. Some rooms have a brick wall view, which may limit natural light.

Hotel 99 offered modern, well-decorated rooms with large LCD TVs and clean bathrooms, but was under construction during the period reviewed, with some rooms not yet completed and the elevator not operational. The hotel faced closure by the fire department due to alarm system issues, leading to guest relocation.

The Beacon Hotel, located in the Upper West Side, offers spacious rooms and suites with kitchenettes, providing a quiet, residential neighborhood experience away from the hustle and bustle of midtown Manhattan, with easy access to Central Park and the subway. Some rooms offer views of Central Park, the Hudson River, or the Ansonia Building.

Hotel Chandler is a small boutique hotel with comfortable rooms, Aveda toiletries, and free tea/coffee in the lobby, located near the Empire State Building and subway lines. Rooms offer amenities such as blackout blinds, iPod docks, flat-screen TVs, and quiet settings away from street noise.

Hotel Deauville is a European-style budget hotel with a vintage lift operated by staff, purple bathrooms, and some rooms feature a kitchenette with a refrig/2 burners/sink combo. It has an "Old World" feel without the frippery of a monster chain, and rooms at the front of the hotel are large and eclectic.
The hotel has a rooftop terrace with views of the city, and the hotel's decor has an Asian minimalist style. The hotel is located in a vibrant and trendy part of town, away from touristy areas.

Hotel Elysee is a small, elegant boutique hotel with a European ambiance, offering a quiet, intimate atmosphere, with breakfast, wine, and snacks included. Rooms are spacious and comfortable, featuring period furnishings, fireplaces, and comfortable beds.

The Gansevoort Hotel is a modern, trendy hotel in the Meatpacking District with a rooftop pool and bar offering great views. It aims to provide a luxurious experience but some guests have noted noise issues and variable service.

Hotel Giraffe is described as a quiet, relaxed, and calm hotel, often providing a welcome break from the hectic streets of New York. It offers a comfortable, intimate atmosphere with luxurious bedding and spacious rooms, making it a peaceful retreat in a central location.

Hotel Grand Union is a budget hotel with small, basic, but clean rooms, some of which have no view or natural daylight; it is located close to subway lines and major attractions, offering a quiet, if unremarkable, space to sleep. Rooms at the back of the hotel are noted to be quieter, providing an escape from street noise.
Hotel Indigo NYC features modern minimalist design, spacious rooms for NYC with comfortable beds, Aveda toiletries, and HD TVs with many channels. Some rooms have city views and a quiet HVAC system.

Hotel Mela offers clean, well-appointed rooms and a quiet atmosphere despite its location near Times Square, with some rooms having no view or natural light. The hotel features a modern style, comfortable beds, and soundproof windows, providing a peaceful respite from the bustling city.
The Hotel Metro is described as an art deco hotel with a rooftop bar offering stunning Empire State Building views. The hotel is centrally located but set on a relatively quiet street.

Hotel Newton is located on the Upper West Side, near the subway, with clean, recently renovated rooms that include microwaves and refrigerators; upper floors offer quiet rooms away from street noise. Some rooms have shared bathrooms, and the elevator can be slow.

The Hotel on Rivington offers rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows offering spectacular views of Manhattan, as well as unique bathrooms with Japanese soaking tubs and glass-enclosed showers. It is located in the Lower East Side, a vibrant neighborhood with nightlife, but some reviews mention street noise and a nightclub-like atmosphere.
Hotel Reserve is a small, modern hotel in New York's Financial District, near several subway lines. The hotel rooms are well-appointed, clean, and quiet.

The St. James Hotel is a budget-friendly option located steps from Times Square, offering basic, clean rooms, though some find it noisy due to the central location. The hotel is undergoing renovations, and the property has some obsolete features, but the location is great for exploring the city.
Rooms are described as quiet, and some offer views away from the street towards a wall, or an alleyway, which contributes to less street noise. There are mentions of old elevators, and slow service.

Hotel Wales is a quaint, older-style hotel with dark wood decor and a rooftop terrace offering views of Central Park and the Upper East Side. Some rooms are small, and renovations have occurred at various times, but the hotel provides a 2nd-floor lounge with complimentary coffee.

The Hudson Hotel has a trendy atmosphere and a lobby that feels like a rainforest with its ivy-covered ceiling, designed for an escape, and offers a library bar for something a bit more conservative. The Phillip Stark design made the hotel quite unique and the shared spaces with quirky furniture, made for a very interesting space.

INK48 is a new, modern hotel located on the west side of Manhattan with large rooms, stylish decor, and city or Hudson River views. The hotel is a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square, offering a slightly removed location from the tourist crowds.

The Inn New York City is a charming, quiet townhouse-style inn located on a residential street on the Upper West Side, near Central Park and the subway; it features uniquely decorated suites with kitchens stocked with complimentary snacks and breakfast items, offering a private and home-like atmosphere. Some suites have special features such as fireplaces, terraces, jacuzzis, and saunas.

The Barclay Intercontinental has a grand lobby, an old-fashioned ambiance, and traditionally furnished rooms. The hotel can be very busy with large numbers of people coming and going, and is used for visiting heads of state.

The Jumeirah Essex House is in a prime location across from Central Park, offers quiet rooms with comfortable beds, and is known for its elegant lobby and proximity to the park. Some suites feature beautiful views of the park, providing a restful escape.

The Kitano is described as a quiet and tranquil hotel with soundproof rooms, offering an oasis of calm in midtown Manhattan near Grand Central Station. It features Japanese-inspired decor, Shiseido toiletries, and green tea service, with some rooms offering Empire State Building views.

The hotel has a rooftop bar with views of the Empire State Building and is near several subway lines. Some rooms are quiet and away from street noise, while the hotel also offers a business center and fitness center.

Lafayette House is a quirky boutique hotel located in a historic 1848 building with uniquely decorated rooms featuring antique furniture, fireplaces, and sitting areas. It offers a private, local NYC experience, with some rooms including kitchenettes and access to a courtyard garden.
Le Parker Meridien is located close to Central Park and subway entrances and has cartoons playing in the elevators and an indoor rooftop pool. Some rooms offer park views from high floors.

The Library Hotel is a homey, literary-themed boutique with a serene atmosphere, offering perks like free Wi-Fi, pastries, wine, and cheese, as well as a lively rooftop bar with garden and skyscraper views. The hotel rooms are organized using the Dewey Decimal System.

The Loews Regency is located on Park Avenue and has large, clean rooms with comfortable beds, and some rooms have kitchenettes and sitting areas. It is near shopping, Central Park, and museums, and some reviewers describe the hotel as offering a calm respite from the city.

The Lowell is a small, intimate hotel on the Upper East Side, off Madison Avenue, with suites that feel like apartments, including kitchenettes and luxurious bathrooms. It is known for its quiet atmosphere and attentive staff, providing an escape from the city's hustle and bustle.

The Mandarin Oriental in New York is located on the 35th floor and up, offering views of Central Park and the Hudson River and creating an oasis of calm and luxury. The hotel has a spa, pool, and a lobby lounge to provide an escape.

The Milford Plaza is near Times Square and Broadway, offering proximity to theaters and shows. The reviewers note the age and condition of the rooms, with some citing small rooms, old furniture, and cleanliness issues.

The Millenium Hilton offers modern, spacious, and very clean rooms with large flat-screen TVs and comfortable beds, often featuring breathtaking views from high floors overlooking the Hudson River, the Brooklyn Bridge, and the downtown skyline. The hotel is generally quiet, especially on weekends, and provides a safe and welcoming environment, offering an escape from the bustling city with its modern amenities and comfortable accommodations.

Located steps from Times Square, the Millennium Broadway offers clean and quiet rooms with views of the Chrysler Building, the Empire State Building and Times Square. Rooms on the higher floors offer a great respite from the hustle and bustle of the city with blackout curtains and soundproofing.

Located near the UN, this hotel offers stunning views of Manhattan, the East River, and landmarks like the Chrysler and Empire State Buildings from its upper floors, providing a quiet escape with a pool on the 27th floor. Some reviewers note the hotel's location is slightly removed from the main attractions, requiring a 5-10 minute walk to Grand Central Station.

The Moderne is a small, clean hotel located close to Times Square and Central Park, with some rooms featuring quirky decor like Andy Warhol prints and silver leather headboards. Some reviewers mention dark rooms with no natural light or views, while others appreciate the quiet atmosphere.

Morgans Hotel has a modern, stylish, black and white theme with orchids in the bathroom, and comfortable beds, and offers a 4th-floor "Living Room" with complimentary tea and coffee. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building and the hotel is located in a quiet area within walking distance of attractions.

Murray Hill East Suites is described as feeling like a home away from home, with reviewers noting that the rooms are spacious, quiet and in a residential neighborhood, offering an escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. The suites are equipped with kitchens, which can allow guests to eat in and enjoy the peace and quiet of their rooms.

The Murray Hill Inn is a budget-friendly, no-frills hotel in Midtown Manhattan with small, clean rooms and basic amenities. It is located on a quiet street within walking distance to major attractions and subway stations.

The Marriott Downtown offers clean, comfortable rooms with great views of the Hudson River and Statue of Liberty, providing a peaceful retreat away from the city's hustle and bustle, and is close to the subway for easy access to other parts of Manhattan. The hotel's downtown location near Battery Park and Ground Zero offers a quieter, less crowded experience compared to midtown.

The hotel is an older building with vintage woods and brass, and the high floor fitness center has great views. Rooms are renovated with new beds/linens, flat screen tvs, and granite bathrooms, with many rooms on the inside of the "U" being quiet from street traffic.

The Marriott Marquis, located in the heart of Times Square, is a large, modern hotel with amenities like a revolving restaurant, glass elevators, and rooms with views. Its central location and size can make it feel like a microcosm of New York City, offering a vibrant and exciting escape.

The New York Palace is described as opulent, luxurious, and grand, with a beautiful courtyard and a location away from the crowded streets of Times Square. Some found the hotel to have a grandness and elegance that made them feel like royalty and provided an escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.

The Night Hotel is a small boutique hotel with a black and white gothic theme, modern decor, and music playing in the hallways, creating an intimate and cocoon-like atmosphere. The rooms have amenities such as comfortable beds, Molton Brown toiletries, and Bose sound systems, and its location is near Times Square.
The Novotel Times Square, with its lobby on the 7th floor, has a terrace offering outstanding views of Times Square. Rooms on higher floors offer views of Times Square and Broadway.

Off Soho Suites offers apartment-like suites with kitchens, providing a sense of independent living. The hotel's location near the Bowery and restaurant supply industry may give a different impression of New York.

The Omni Berkshire Place offers quiet, spacious rooms, and is centrally located off 5th Avenue, providing a convenient yet peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of midtown Manhattan. Several reviewers described it as a haven and "second home".

Located on the Upper West Side, this hotel is outside of the touristy midtown area and described as being in a "real" neighborhood, near Central Park, and offering a quiet atmosphere. Some reviewers noted good views from higher floors and balconies.

Park 79 is an older building near Central Park with small, clean rooms, and some rooms have shared bathrooms; the hotel has a historical feel, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The Upper West Side location is quiet, near museums, shops and restaurants, and within walking distance of subway lines.
Rooms are clean, reasonably spacious and quiet, with blackout curtains and double pane glass. The lobby and bar have a nice design and atmosphere.

The Park South Hotel is a smaller boutique hotel with clean and comfortable rooms, a restaurant, and a bar; it is located in Murray Hill near the subway. Some reviewers mention that the atmosphere provides an international ambiance.

The Peninsula New York offers a rooftop pool with city views, a spa, and is described as a quiet, elegant hotel with intimate public spaces and luxurious rooms that provide a calm escape. Some found the hotel had Asian-level hospitality and appreciated the high-end amenities like the gym and Pen Top bar.

The Phillips Club offers studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments with kitchens, providing a feeling of having your own elegant apartment in New York, with a lobby that feels special. It is located near Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle, with convenient access to transportation.

The Plaza Athenee is described as an intimate, quiet, European-style boutique hotel with a residential feel, located on a tree-lined street on the Upper East Side, near Central Park. Some rooms offer city views, and the hotel has a cozy bar and a restaurant with a relaxing atmosphere.

The Radisson Martinique, formerly the Holiday Inn Broadway, is near the Empire State Building and a subway station. Reviews mention executive suites, large rooms, sleep number beds, and club level access.

The Ramada Eastside offers clean and comfortable rooms with Tempur-Pedic mattresses, providing a good night's sleep; some rooms on higher floors have city views. It is located in the quieter Murray Hill neighborhood, away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, offering a peaceful retreat.

The Red Roof Inn Manhattan is centrally located near the Empire State Building and Penn Station, with rooms that are clean and updated. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building and include amenities like free Wi-Fi, LCD TVs, and comfortable beds.

Hotel 57 is a chic, modern, and sleek boutique hotel that some reviewers said felt like a hidden gem. It has a European feel, a sleek and modern decor with warm lighting and artistic glass, and an intimate and personal atmosphere.

The Renaissance New York Times Square is centrally located and soundproofed against the hustle and bustle; the restaurant and bar offer great views of Times Square, and it's conveniently located near the subway, theaters, and other attractions. The hotel features modern, recently renovated rooms, comfortable beds, and quality service.

The Residence Inn Times Square offers spacious, well-decorated rooms with comfortable beds, soundproofing, and spectacular views from upper floors. Some reviewers mention the hotel feels like a retreat and offers a quiet respite from the bustling city.

Located at the tip of Manhattan, this hotel is described as a quiet escape with waterfront views, offering a peaceful atmosphere away from the hustle of midtown. The hotel's location near Battery Park and its quiet rooms contribute to a relaxing experience.

The Rockefeller Center Hotel is centrally located near Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, and 5th Avenue. It features modern, clean rooms, some with kitchenettes, and offers amenities like free internet access and filtered water.

The Roger Smith Hotel is described as homey, cozy, and unique, with each room decorated differently and featuring art, books, and antiques. It is located in midtown Manhattan, near Grand Central Station, offering a convenient escape from the bustling city.

The Roger Williams Hotel is a trendy boutique hotel with bright, modern decor, praised for its comfortable beds and convenient Midtown location, offering a stylish but cozy atmosphere. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building and terraces.

Room Mate Grace is a trendy, modern hotel with a hip vibe and a pool/bar area that creates a lively atmosphere, with themed nights and DJs; the pool area includes a sauna and steam room, and many rooms have interesting views of the city. The hotel is centrally located near Times Square, subways, and other attractions.

The Royalton is a hip, trendy boutique hotel with a dark, mysterious atmosphere and a recently renovated lobby featuring a fireplace. Its design includes dim lighting, with unique rooms, some including fireplaces and round bathtubs.
The Salisbury Hotel, established in 1939, is described as having old-world charm and dated decor. Some rooms face away from the street, potentially offering a quieter stay.

The San Carlos Hotel is a smaller, quiet boutique hotel with spacious, clean rooms, Aveda bath products, and comfortable beds; some rooms include kitchenettes with microwaves and refrigerators. Some guests note the serene atmosphere and quietness of the rooms, while the owner is known to personally greet guests, creating a welcoming environment.

Seafarers International House is a basic, clean, and affordable guesthouse near Union Square, offering rooms with shared or private bathrooms. The guesthouse has a chapel, library, and common room, and is run by a Christian organization.

The hotel has amazing views, especially from higher floors and club rooms, and features a gym, lobby bar, and sometimes free internet access in the lobby. Note that some guests found that the hotel was noisy and always busy with large groups.

The Skyline Hotel offers a heated indoor pool with skyline views and rooms with comfortable beds and large plasma TVs, providing a change of pace from the bustling city. While the hotel may be a bit dated, it offers spacious and clean rooms, a quiet location, and is within walking distance to Times Square and many restaurants.

The Smyth Tribeca is a stylish, modern hotel with a minimalist design, offering quiet and comfortable rooms with soundproofing, and a lobby with cozy nooks. Its location in Tribeca provides a less touristy experience, while still being conveniently located near subway lines for easy access to other parts of Manhattan.

The Sofitel New York offers quiet rooms and an elegant atmosphere, providing a respite from the city's bustle, with amenities like classical music playing in the evenings. Its rooms are spacious and soundproofed, effectively blocking out street traffic and other disturbances.

The Soho Grand Hotel has a hip, trendy atmosphere with a cool lobby bar, modern, stylish and clean rooms, and design-oriented spaces. Some rooms have great city views, and the hotel offers amenities like a goldfish for company.

Soho House New York features spacious, uniquely decorated rooms with vintage furniture, modern amenities, and oversized bathtubs, along with a rooftop pool and bar offering skyline views. Guests also have access to a private cinema, games room, and a range of freebies including spa products and useful magazines.

The Stay Hotel is a trendy, modern hotel with a hip lobby featuring aquariums and funky lighting, with a bar/lounge (Aspen Social Club) that has a Montana lodge theme. The hotel rooms are small, and noise may be an issue on lower floors due to the bar/club and thin walls.

The Alex Hotel offers guests a modern, minimalist aesthetic, and quiet rooms due to the limited number of rooms per floor. Some suites include kitchens, balconies, and views of the Chrysler Building and East River.

The Belvedere Hotel is located on a quiet street just off 8th Avenue near Times Square and provides a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. Some reviewers describe the hotel's art deco style lobby and clean, comfortable rooms as havens.

The Benjamin is a boutique hotel with spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and amenities including a pillow menu, soundproof windows, and optional sound machines. Some reviewers noted the rooms can be noisy due to the location in midtown Manhattan.

The Blakely is described as a small boutique hotel with an old-world feel, offering comfortable and spacious rooms that are quiet despite its central Manhattan location, providing a calm and intimate atmosphere. Some reviewers mention dark decor and cozy lobby, which might contribute to a feeling of enclosure and escape from the bustling city.

The Bowery Hotel has a vintage old-world design with wooden panelled walls, age-darkened mirrors, and subdued lighting to make it look like it has always been there. The lobby and bar areas are cozy and comfortable with a fireplace, and the rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows with city views.

The Bryant Park Hotel offers a central location across from Bryant Park, providing a tranquil escape from the city's hustle, with some rooms featuring park views and blackout shades for a peaceful retreat. Some reviewers mention the sound machines that provide white noise to help guests sleep.

The Carlton on Madison is centrally located with an impressive entrance and well-designed, clean, and stylish rooms that are quiet, with comfortable beds. The grand lobby is atmospheric, and the corridors have a creepy Ghost-busters looking vibe.

The Carlyle is a classic, old-school luxury hotel with a residential feel, offering personalized service and a quiet atmosphere with white-gloved elevator operators. It has an old New York feel, with a lobby featuring black marble floors, fresh roses, and art deco touches, and is known for attracting celebrities and high-profile guests.

The Franklin Hotel is a small, boutique hotel on the Upper East Side with a European feel and charming decor, offering a complimentary continental breakfast and evening wine and cheese. The hotel features uniquely decorated, albeit small, rooms with amenities like comfortable beds, high-quality linens, and Bulgari toiletries.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments is a charming, European-style hotel with elegant, clean rooms decorated in a French Orleans style, some with balconies. The hotel is located on Restaurant Row, close to Times Square, but the rooms are generally quiet.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea has a modern, European-style aesthetic with spotlit orchids and rooms designed for efficient use of space. Some reviewers noted the hotel felt new and provided a boutique experience.

The Gem Hotel has minimalist, stylish, and modern rooms that offer a quiet and cool retreat from the city bustle. Some rooms have bathrobes, and the hotel is located off the beaten path in a calmer area near an industrial zone.
The Gem Soho is located in a lively part of town, near the East Village, Little Italy, and Chinatown. It is described as cozy and quiet, with comfortable beds and linens.

The Grant Hotel is described as quiet and warm, offering an escape from the city noise, and is located in a safe neighborhood near Riverside Park. The rooms are clean and reasonably appointed, with shared bathrooms.
The Hampton Inn has clean, quiet rooms and comfortable beds with good quality linens. You can also request a room away from street noise or at the back of the building.

The Helmsley Carlton House Hotel is located on the upper east side of Manhattan, one block from Central Park, with spacious rooms and suites, some including kitchenettes and balconies overlooking Central Park. Some reviewers mention the presence of permanent residents.

The Helmsley Park Lane is located on Central Park South, directly across from Central Park, and many reviewers highlight the spectacular views of the park and the city skyline from rooms on higher floors. The hotel's decor is described as dated, old-fashioned, and gaudy, with references to 1970s and 1980s styles, mirrored ceilings, floral patterns, and bold colors like purple and red.

Rooms can be dark, some face air shafts or walls with no view and limited natural light, but are generally quiet, and some rooms have wooden shutters. The hotel has reproduction art from Life Magazine on the walls.

Hotel 91 is located in the heart of Manhattan's Chinatown, described as a busy area, like being in another world, and away from the main New York attractions. The hotel's proximity to the Manhattan Bridge may be noisy, but rooms have double-paned windows.

The Hotel at Times Square is located in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, nearby many attractions like Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and 5th Avenue. The hotel has been recently renovated with modern decor, and is described as clean, quiet, and comfortable.

The Inn at Irving Place is a hidden treasure with authentic 19th-century decor, tucked away without signage, giving the feeling of stepping into another world. It is described as a quiet oasis of calm in Manhattan, offering a unique and unbelievable escape within the city.

The Iroquois is a small, quiet, and elegant boutique hotel that feels like an oasis, with comfortable, soundproof rooms, Molton Brown toiletries, Frette linens/robes, and attentive staff. Triomphe restaurant and quaint library in the lobby add to the cozy, intimate setting away from the hustle and bustle of midtown Manhattan.

The Jane Hotel has a vintage vibe, with small cabin-like rooms reminiscent of a ship, and an old-style elevator. It is located in a historic building that once housed Titanic survivors, and some reviewers mention a haunted feeling and seeing ghosts.

The Kimberly Hotel offers a quiet respite with spacious suites, comfortable beds, and balconies, located conveniently near major attractions. It has traditional decor, some offering views and a fully equipped kitchen.

The Lombardy is a small boutique hotel with individually decorated, spacious rooms that are studio or one-bedroom apartments with kitchens; it is known to be quiet, and feels like having your own high-end apartment in Manhattan. The hotel is centrally located, near restaurants, shops, and the subway.

The London NYC offers spacious, quiet rooms with blackout curtains and soundproofing that ensures a peaceful stay, with some high floor rooms providing views of Central Park and the city. The hotel's ambiance is modern and stylish, with some reviewers noting it feels like stepping into another world or like a luxury apartment.

The Lucerne is described as a quiet and clean hotel, with some reviewers noting an absolutely silent room and a quiet oasis in the city. It is located on the Upper West Side, away from the hustle and bustle of Midtown.
The Manhattan Club is centrally located, close to Times Square and Central Park. Some penthouse suites offer quiet and spacious accommodations.

The Mansfield Hotel, with its European feel, literary vibe, and library with a fireplace, is a quiet and comforting boutique hotel despite its central Manhattan location near Times Square and Grand Central. The hotel's ambiance includes narrow hallways, winding staircases, marble floors, and a library/reading room, offering a welcome retreat after a busy day of shopping and sightseeing.

The Marcel has modern, funky decor and a rooftop terrace, with a cool and stylish vibe, that some guests find thrilling and a bit awe-inspiring. The hotel has a lounge on the 10th floor, and is located in the Gramercy Park area which is less touristy than other areas.

The Maritime Hotel has a nautical theme, with rooms designed like ship cabins featuring porthole windows. The hotel's design creates a unique atmosphere, with dark hallways and a submarine feel, offering an alternative to typical city hotels.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side, close to museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping. It offers spacious rooms, and some rooms overlook an inner courtyard, providing a quiet escape from city noise.

The Marmara Manhattan offers spacious apartment-style suites with full kitchens, providing a residential feel on the Upper East Side, away from the tourist crowds of Midtown. Guests have noted the quiet neighborhood, proximity to Central Park, and city views from higher floors as positive aspects of their stay.
The hotel's lobby is decorated with vibrant colors of red and balloons, creating a chic, stylish, and vibrant feel with no public space. The rooms are clean and modern.

The Mercer is a chic, understated boutique hotel in SoHo with a tranquil atmosphere, soundproofed rooms, and a lobby bar exclusively for residents. It is known for its minimalist rooms, comfortable beds, and large bathrooms with oversized tubs, providing a relaxing and quiet escape from the city.

The Michelangelo Hotel is described as a quiet and serene oasis with a European ambiance, offering spacious rooms, a beautiful lobby with classical music, and a location convenient to Times Square and Broadway. The hotel provides a haven from the busy NYC streets.

The Milburn Hotel is located on the Upper West Side, offering a quiet respite from the busy city with spacious, clean rooms, some with kitchenettes and comfortable beds. It is near Central Park and Riverside Park, providing a peaceful, residential neighborhood experience.

The Muse Hotel is a trendy, modern, and clean boutique hotel near Times Square with uniquely decorated rooms that have comfortable beds and are relatively quiet, with many offering good views of the city. It also provides convenient access to theaters and shopping.

The NY Helmsley has a swanky, old New York lobby and some rooms offer nice views such as the Chrysler Building and Empire State Building. The rooms were described as a decent size by NYC standards, often with a large TV and spacious bathrooms.

The New Yorker Hotel, built in 1929 in Art Deco style, features art deco styling in the lobby, elevators, corridors, and rooms, with skyline views from upper floors. Views include the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Hudson River, and Madison Square Garden.

The Pierre is described as an iconic hotel with old-world charm, featuring architectural details like a functional mail chute, expansive marble lobby, and crown moldings. Some reviewers mention that the hotel transports them to a different time with its classic style and dedicated staff, including elevator operators.

The Plaza is a Beaux-Arts landmark hotel across from Central Park with spacious rooms, high ceilings, elegant architectural details, and marble-lined bathrooms. Some suites have a private patio with lounge chairs and fountains amid the skyscrapers, and guests have access to a private butler.

The Pod Hotel is a funky and modern budget hotel with rooftop and garden areas offering views. It has unique design elements like small, but functional "pods" with ipod docking stations, flat screen tvs, and shared or private bathrooms featuring overhead showers.

The Premier is described as a boutique hotel within the Millennium Broadway, offering clean, quiet, and modern rooms with amenities like flat-screen TVs. Some reviewers note the hotel's quiet atmosphere and convenient location near Times Square, providing a haven of peace and quiet after a day of sightseeing.

The Ritz Carlton Central Park is known for its spacious, quiet rooms with comfortable beds and luxurious bathrooms; park view rooms offer views of Central Park, and the hotel provides a complimentary car service. It is located across from Central Park, providing an escape from the busy city.

The Roosevelt Hotel has a grand lobby, which can evoke feelings of stepping back in time to the 1930s or into a romantic movie set, but some find that the rooms are old-fashioned or tired. The rooftop bar offers panoramic city views.

The Sherry-Netherland offers spacious rooms with unique decor, some featuring Central Park views, binoculars, and telescopes. It is known for its quiet and serene atmosphere, providing a respite from the city's hustle and bustle.

The Shoreham is a modern, trendy boutique hotel with a minimalist, stylish design, offering features like a massage chair, Aveda products, a 24-hour espresso bar, and options for champagne upon arrival. Rooms feature comfortable beds and flat-screen TVs, with some rooms offering balconies and unique layouts, though some guests have noted small room and bathroom sizes.

The St. Regis is described as a luxurious and elegant hotel with spacious, quiet rooms, comfortable beds, and butler service, offering a peaceful retreat from the busy city. The hotel features traditionally decorated rooms, marble bathrooms, and amenities like complimentary coffee/tea service and shoe shines.

The hotel is constructed on massive concrete stilts, giving it an impressive appearance and cutting-edge design with a cool feel. The elevator has video screens playing a mesmerizing presentation with music, and the hotel offers floor-to-ceiling windows with impressive views.

The Surrey is a smallish boutique hotel on the upper East Side, located on a quiet street among townhouses, one block from Central Park and close to museums. The hotel is elegantly furnished and decorated, with spacious rooms and suites that include kitchenettes.

The Sylvan Guest House is located in a historical Harlem neighborhood on Sylvan Terrace, near the Jumel Mansion. It features apartments with well-equipped kitchens, access to a terrace, and decor with African art.
The Time Hotel offers funky, modern decor and themed rooms in colors like red, blue, and yellow but can be small and vary in quality; the bar can be loud, and the hotel is near Times Square.

The Waldorf Astoria is described as a grand, historic hotel with opulent art deco lobbies and rooms spacious for New York City standards. Some guests mention that it feels like stepping back in time, and admire the beautiful detailing of the floors, ceilings, and elevator doors.

The Westin New York at Times Square is located in the heart of the city and offers a tranquil oasis with quiet rooms that provide a welcome escape from the city's noise. The hotel features the signature Heavenly Bed, offering a comfortable and serene experience, and is within walking distance of many attractions, including theaters and Times Square.

The Thirty Thirty Hotel is described as a "small boutique hotel, offering sleek accommodations in a quiet location" with a "hip, minimalist design" lobby, aiming to be a "home away from home getaway spot." However, some found that "the rooms are small, rugs a bit frayed , AC noisy ...and external (outside)noise levels are quite high," making it less of an escape.

The Thompson LES offers modern, stylish rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows providing stunning views of the city. Some reviewers mention rooftop bars and pools that offer an escape, though note these may not always be open.

The Travel Inn is centrally located and within walking distance of Times Square, but is reported to be quiet, especially rooms facing the pool.  There is also a pool, which some reviewers felt provided an escape in bustling NYC.

The Tribeca Grand is a trendy hotel known for its stylish lobby and bar scene, with spacious rooms that offer a sound masking system to minimize noise. The hotel provides a sleek, European styling and access to concerts, broadway plays, shopping, and exceptional food.

The Trump International Hotel and Tower offers spacious suites with floor-to-ceiling windows providing spectacular views of Central Park and Columbus Circle, as well as luxurious amenities like jacuzzi tubs, high-end linens, and full kitchens. Guests have noted the hotel's quiet atmosphere and exceptional service contribute to a peaceful and serene environment.

The Tudor Hotel is located in the quiet Tudor City neighborhood near the United Nations, providing a quiet escape from the bustling city with Tudor-style architecture and small parks offering East River views. Some reviewers found the hotel to be an older property with small, quaint rooms.

The Avalon Vincci is a conveniently-located hotel with spacious rooms that provide a quiet escape from the city with well-climated rooms and comfortable beds.  The rooms often include sitting areas and opulent marble bathrooms with high quality towels and toiletries.

The W The Court is a stylish and modern hotel with dark, trendy decor, hip music, and a bar scene that gets lively at night. The location provides a residential feel while being close to midtown attractions.

The W Tuscany is described as a sophisticated, cosy gem hidden away in central Manhattan, offering a calm and quiet feeling in contrast to the city's hustle and bustle. It is also known for its trendy decor and modern style.

The W Times Square is a trendy, modern hotel with a glass ceiling entrance, waterfall features, and sleek, dark decor. Rooms offer comfortable beds, iPod docking stations, and amazing views of Times Square from high floors, providing a luxury hideaway amidst the action.

The W Union Square is a stylish, trendy hotel with comfortable beds and a happening lobby scene, while the rooms are furnished in dark, warm colors, creating a calm and cozy atmosphere. Some found it an oasis in NYC, with decor muted, yet modern, and the overall experience one of upscale relaxation.

The Waldorf Towers provides an old-world, classic experience with spacious rooms and suites, a private entrance, and attentive staff, offering a sense of stepping back in time. It is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan, providing easy access to many iconic NYC attractions.

The Wall Street Inn is a small, quiet boutique hotel located in the Financial District, an area that is especially quiet on the weekends. It is described as an oasis of calm away from the hustle and bustle of midtown.

The Warwick is described as historic, classy and having old-world charm, with quiet rooms that provide a respite from the city, though some rooms have views of brick walls. It is centrally located near Times Square and Central Park.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel is described as a small, clean, and modern hotel, but some reviewers mention the noise from the street, garbage trucks, and other guests. Rooms on the back side of the hotel facing the courtyard are quieter, with some reviewers noting the hotel is located near Times Square and Broadway.

The Washington Square Hotel is described as charming, quaint, and with an old-world feel, featuring art deco touches and a lobby decorated with photos of movie idols from the golden age of cinema. Some found it to have a "Greta-Garbo vibe," while others appreciated its European style, and a number of reviews highlight the hotel's Greenwich Village location as an escape from the busier parts of Manhattan.
The Wellington is an old hotel with vintage decor and charm, but some rooms are small, dark, and outdated. The hotel is in an excellent central location near Central Park and Times Square.

The hotel's rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows with city views from the shower and a terrace on the 25th floor with night lights; the rooms also have technological enhancements, marble shower stalls, and high-end toiletries. The hotel has a modern, contemporary design, with an owner's lounge for breakfast and snacks.
The Wingate Inn provides a white noise machine and earplugs to mitigate noise. Rooms away from the street or on upper floors tend to be quieter, and some have nature noises available.

The Wolcott Hotel, built in 1904, is a historic hotel with a grand lobby, large rooms, and pre-war New York ambiance. It is centrally located near the Empire State Building, Macy's, and Times Square, but some find it old, noisy, and in need of a makeover.

Woogo Central Park Apartments, located on the Upper West Side near Central Park and close to a subway station, offers apartment-style accommodations with kitchenettes, providing a sense of living like a New York resident rather than a tourist. Some rooms have rooftop terraces with skyline views.

The Wyndham Garden Hotel features a garden-themed restaurant with glass walls, an outdoor tenth-floor terrace, and rooms designed with clear modern lines. The rooms are quiet, have great curtains for privacy, and are equipped with air purifiers.
